Reviews.Title: “Great location & price in the mix of a lively plaza”
Reviews.Author: j3dnight
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Spain. Most of my time was spent in Madrid I wanted a hotel that was in a central location with good transportation options for getting around or for daytrips. For me, Hostal Plaza D'ort was a good choice. I had the metro nearby at Puerto del Sol and could easily get to the train stations for Segovia & Toledo. The hop on/hop off bus stop was just down the street and a lot of attractions are within walking distance. I had a single room that was small but it had everything that I needed. Later (without me asking) they moved me to a bigger room. I surely appreciated that. It's located on a lively plaza and I always felt safe. There are many shops, restaurants and pubs nearby. The staff was very helpful and friendly. I'm very happy with my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hostel, bad for even budget hostels”
Reviews.Author: Plavec_H
Reviews.Content: Smallest room Imaginable. Halfway down the bed was a table that was elevated that the TV rested on. When laying down I could reach the shower . Though cheap and budget you still expect more, especially size. Room was most likely 5 feet by 6, at most. Smelled like smoke, cigarette burns on sheets. Asked to see other rooms for quality. More cigarette burns on the sheets. I recommend going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “they charged us twice! never go here!”
Reviews.Author: Wiggily
Reviews.Content: These people charged us twice for one night and are now refusing to return the money, although we provided them with copies of bank account statements. They are treating us horribly, not replying to our email etc. The place is filthy and they don't speak English. A horrible place. Please avoid it at any cost.

Reviews.Title: “Really pleasant hostel”
Reviews.Author: marguarite82
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay in this hostel, we had a twin room with bathroom for only 202 euro for 4 nights. Staff was really helpful, location excellent (only 5 min of walking from Sol), our room was cleaned every day, the only disadvantage was no lift and our room was on the 4th floor, but compared to everything else it wasn´t that bad :-)

Reviews.Title: “This is a budget accommodation!”
Reviews.Author: LBPurnell
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the complaints about this place. I've stayed any many budget hostals in my time and this place is no different. If you want an elevator and rooms that smell like jazmine, then dish out the extra money and stay at a 3-4 star hotel. Yes, the rooms are small and we had a shared bath down the hall. But the location is excellent, a short walk to Plaza Mayor. The service was also excellent and Esteban gave great pointers about the city. If your on a budget, then this place is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “STAY away unless you are young and don;t mind STAIRS!!”
Reviews.Author: aztec607
Reviews.Content: GREAT Location! Puerta de Sol, Plaza Mayor, Palacio, Prado!! Near buy great place to buy Spanish Table cloths and hand work!! Second street towards Puerta del SOL! Hostal starts on 3rd FLOOR! NO ELEVATOR! TINY< TINY ROOMS! EVEN TINIER SHOWER IN ROOM! OH MY, about drowned as the water filled up around my neck!! NOISE from street! VERY CLEAN! SMELL OF CIGATETTE! Charged for cancelation made 3 months in advance, just changed date!! Publicized that that does not happen! Left something in room, was able to pick up later! VERY nice on of the men, other two, well! I guess it is the MADRID personality! Good LUCK!

Reviews.Title: “A bang for your buck”
Reviews.Author: Gavinsm3
Reviews.Content: Come on guys, don't be such complainers, its not that bad!!! Yes, I had to climb 2 flights of stairs, it smelled a bit like cigarettes and the rooms are small, but... The location was AWESOME The price was AWESOME The customer service was great, they let me check it at 9AM, try that at a Hilton. And I had ZERO cleanliness complains. Free internet access was nice too.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Raquel10
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because of it´s location, it IS in fact very central, but not at all worth it! The rooms smell like cigarettes, and when we complained they said they could get rid of the smell (which they didn´t!). There are no elevators, so you have to lug your luggages three stories up! The room is VERY tiny (even for european standards), and the bed caves in when you lay down! I would not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: elizrosen
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this Hostal received 3.5 starts out of 5. We had to climb 82 stairs one way to get to our room. The room was so dirty, there was that red shower/toilet mold or whatever it was growing in the shower. I totally disinfected everything. Also, to top it all off, we went into the community room to use the free wifi, that was shotty at best, and the night manager was in there watching porn. SO GROSS! I've stayed at a fair amount of hostals in my life and I'm expecting the Ritz Carlton but I mean come on. Beware too expensive and dirty!

Reviews.Title: “An over-rated hostal?”
Reviews.Author: JulesSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: This hostal, although acceptable, seems to be over-rated by many guides. My single initially was a 5-flight walkup, and the room was about the size (I'd imagine) of a jail cell. After that first night, I insisted on a larger room on a lower floor, which I was given after some negotiation (e.g., ended up paying a higher rate). The staff was pleasant and helpful, especially Alfredo. Very clean, and well-located, although I prefer the quieter, less touristy neighborhood around c/Cervantes. .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value & standards”
Reviews.Author: littlerussell
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have stayed in a "Hostal" as I was unable to find a mid-range hotel at very short notice. I was extremely impressed. In fact, the only difference between the four star hotels and this hostal was the size of the room (a single, which was particularly small. (But the price was about 1/3 of what I usually pay). Standards of cleanliness and furnishing in the room itself were excellent. The service was excellent & all of the desk staff I dealt with were exceptionally helpful. The location was within a 3-4 minute walk of the Plaza Mayor. The only slight gripe (as with many Spanish hotels) was it could be a little noisy at times, although a set of earplugs solved that! Given that I have previously paid four times as much for "Four Star" & chain hotels with far worse standards, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: nessagr
Reviews.Content: This hostal has a great location. It is right in the city center, within walking distance of most Madrid tourist sites, as well as tons of stores and restaurants. It is right next to Plaza Santa Ana and Calle Huertas, a very popular plaza and street where many madrileños start their nightlife. Regarding the actual hostal, the rooms are clean, and some of the bathrooms are amazing. Others have not been renovated yet, so try to get a new bathroom if you can. The rooms are for the most part small, though some of the ones for bigger groups (the quad and the apartment) are very spacious. It can be a little noisy at times, because the walls are thin, and there is no elevator, so if you have a lot of luggage, be prepared to drag it up many flights of stairs. The outside-facing rooms are not too noisy because the plaza right outside it not busy and traffic is minimal. I would recommend this hostal to people looking for a clean, no-frills, safe place to stay with an amazing location. I´m going back next week and will probably stay here on other future visits to Madrid. The staff is very friendly and accommodating, too.
